image.altText: Tasmanian Liberal politician Nic Street.

items.synopsis: The minister responsible for Tasmania's community services sector — which includes mental health, disability and homelessness organisations — apologised to the peak body for last week's state budget, which he described as "inadequate".

title.children: 'What we're spending isn't adequate': Minister apologises to welfare advocates for budget

image.altText: a group of male students wearing backpacks walk through a uni campus away from the camera. their faces can't be seen

items.synopsis: For the past decade, student debts have increased by about 2 per cent a year on average, but tomorrow they will rise by a massive 7.1 per cent. The consequences of increased debt will affect graduates for decades.

title.children: Indexation of student debts to have lifelong impacts on Australians' borrowing capacity

image.altText: An historic photo of a 36-year-old man's face. He has green eyes and a goatee.

items.synopsis: A couple accused of murdering their former son-in-law in Tasmania in 2009 told police they were in the area at the time because they'd gone to KFC. But as a jury has heard, CCTV from the restaurant shows no sign of them.

title.children: Murder accused couple's KFC alibi questioned after CCTV shows no sign of them

image.altText: Graphic showing the merging of a human head and electronic circuits

items.synopsis: Top artificial intelligence executives join experts and professors in raising the "risk of extinction from AI", urging politicians to equate it with risks posed by pandemics and nuclear war.

title.children: Tech world warns risk of extincition from AI should be a global priority

image.altText: Antarctica hits new low sea ice extent

items.synopsis: Antarctica's sea ice is now reforming as the continent moves deeper into the austral winter, but it's currently the smallest it has ever been for this time of year on record. This blip in the Antarctic pulse is the latest in a string of record lows that is being watched carefully by scientists.

title.children: Satellite data reveals chilling blip in Antarctica's sea ice, this is what it looks like from space

image.altText: Former Hawthorn senior management Chris Fagan, Alastair Clarkson and Jason Burt.

items.synopsis: An independent panel investigating allegations of racism at the Hawthorn Football Club concludes, making no adverse findings against former senior coaches and managers.

title.children: AFL shuts down Hawthorn racism review as First Nations players seek to 'resolve all differences'

image.altText: A worker abseils against a building to inspect drone damage.

items.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin says the biggest-ever drone strike on Moscow targeted civilians, accusing Ukraine of an attack that would warrant a "severe" response.

title.children: Russia warns Ukraine of harsh response after 'terrorist' drone strike on Moscow

image.altText: A composite of three images

items.synopsis: With almost half of Australians having a parent born overseas, multicultural Australians' vote in the Voice referendum could prove significant. It's a cohort both the Yes and No campaigns are trying to court with community forums.

title.children: 'We can no longer be ignored': Why the Yes and No campaigns are courting multicultural votes ahead of the Voice referendum

image.altText: A man in a dark navy suit and pink tie speaks in parliament, with an Indigenous female minister sitting behind, watching on

items.synopsis: The new Australian Centre for Evaluation will be tasked with examining whether government programs work — before they are rolled out. Imagine how much good it could do if it's allowed to, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: Will Albanese live up to his own promises to end pork-barrelling? There is a sliver of hope

image.altText: Artist impression of a pterosaur flying over a beach

items.synopsis: Fossils dated to 107 million years old have been confirmed as the oldest evidence in Australia of the prehistoric flying reptile that some liken to the mythical dragon.

title.children: 100 million years ago, Victoria sat inside the Antarctic Circle — and dragons prowled the icy skies

image.altText: Chris Jordan stares intently while answering a question at Senate Estimates. His brow is furrowed.

items.synopsis: The Australian Taxation Office raised concerns about a confidentiality breach at PwC to Australian Federal Police in March 2018, but a lack of detail meant no investigation was launched.

title.children: Lack of detail stopped federal police initially investigating PwC breach

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: Treasury boss Steven Kennedy says he was able to refer PwC to police for investigation thanks to a push by senators to expose the depth of the firm's tax leak scandal.

title.children: 'Clearly disturbing': Treasury referred PwC to police after emails exposed by Senate

image.altText: Composite image of Josh Elmes

items.synopsis: The grieving parents of one of the teenage victims of the car crash tragedy near Hamilton, in western Victoria, have pleaded with other youths to speak up if a driver is going too fast.

title.children: 'If only he'd said, that's a bit too fast': Parents' heartbreaking plea after teens die in high-speed crash

image.altText: A man surrounded by cameras.

items.synopsis: The Federal Court reveals the defamation action of former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann against the News Corp media organisation has ended.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann settles defamation action against News Life Media

image.altText: Female expeditioners on a snow covered beach on a remote island.

items.synopsis: It's nine years since cats, rats, and rabbits were officially declared eradicated from sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island, but scientists fear a new threat is challenging its fragile ecosystem.

title.children: 'Rats running up your legs': Macquarie Island free from pests for nine years, so how's it faring?

image.altText: A close-up shot of a logo of Crown Resorts on the top of a high-rise building in Perth.

items.synopsis: Crown Resorts and government financial intelligence agency AUSTRAC agree to a $450 million penalty over historical non-compliance with Australia's anti-money laundering laws.

title.children: Crown hit with third-largest fine in Australian corporate history over money laundering breaches

image.altText: A court sketch of Malka Leifer.

items.synopsis: A new civil trial alleging sexual abuse by former Melbourne school principal Malka Leifer is averted after a last-minute settlement is reached.

title.children: Malka Leifer civil trial avoided after complainant reaches settlement with school

image.altText: Adam Brown, a man wearing glasses, smirks for a selfie.

items.synopsis: A man who stabbed his wife to death at their home in Melbourne's eastern suburbs after an argument over their child's kindergarten has been handed a 24-year prison sentence.

title.children: Man who fatally stabbed wife after an argument over their child's kindergarten given 24-year sentence

image.altText: Nakkiah Lui and Miranda Tapsell on Get Krackin

items.synopsis: When Miranda Tapsell appeared on a satire of breakfast TV four years ago and bared her fury at the way the media had been stoking the fires of racism and xenophobia, she also braced herself for a backlash.

title.children: Miranda Tapsell reflects on the 'surprising' reaction to her Get Krack!n racism monologue

image.altText: Ethan Ewing, wearing a black wetsuit, holds one hand in the air as he carves through a wave on his surfboard.

items.synopsis: Leading Australian surfer Ethan Ewing receives a death threat as Brazilian fans erupt over judging at the Surf Ranch Pro.

title.children: Australian surfer Ethan Ewing told next event in Brazil will be 'your funeral'

image.altText: A large pre-fab house

items.synopsis: April's building approvals data shows 11,594 homes were approved for construction last month — down 24.1 per cent on the previous year. Meanwhile Treasury officials fronted Senate Estimates to answer questions about PwC.

title.children: Historic bust facing building sector after 'profitless boom' as approvals hit weakest level in 11 years

image.altText: Brendan Godfrey looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: A man who has pleaded guilty to menacing another man via social media says he and an associate did it because the victim was posting misinformation about COVID-19 online — something which angered him as he was awaiting a kidney transplant.

title.children: Pair created fake social media profiles to 'taunt, mock and ridicule' COVID sceptic, court hears

image.altText: Two fire fighters on a street in front of a burnt out building

items.synopsis: Cadaver-detection dogs were used to search the rubble for any human remains after the demolition concludes.

title.children: Demolition underway at inner city Sydney building destroyed by major blaze

image.altText: Novak Djokovic defends Kosovo message on camera

items.synopsis: The tennis superstar said Kosovo was the "heart of Serbia" despite it being recognised as a sovereign state 15 years ago.

title.children: How Djokovic's message on a camera lens sparked outrage in Kosovo

image.altText: A young female soldier smiles while holding a rifle

items.synopsis: In Ukraine, they call her Witch, but the origins of Olha Bihar's call sign remain almost as secretive as the start date of Ukraine's long-awaited counteroffensive.

title.children: Olha fought in Bakhmut and witnessed the full cruelty of Wagner commanders who forced their own troops into minefields at gunpoint

image.altText: A man wears a lanyard with the Australian Government coat of arms on it.

items.synopsis: The federal government has outlined its plan to fix "pay fragmentation" — large differences in salaries among staff employed at the same level.

title.children: Lowest-paid public servants to receive salary boost under plan to reduce pay gaps

image.altText: A woman standing next to a grave with a cross on it

items.synopsis: A police officer involved in the arrest of an Indigenous Queensland man told his colleague to "choke this c**t out" shortly before he died, a court hears.

title.children: 'He's asleep, let him go': Inquest to investigate police actions in Indigenous man's death in custody

image.altText: A dingo surrounded by dried grass

items.synopsis: The study used a new genetic analysis system that shows dingoes don't have as much dog ancestry as previously studied.

title.children: New research suggests dingoes are far more purebred than previous studies show

image.altText: Close-ups of the faces of three people, one man and two women, with each face separated by a white line.

items.synopsis: A huge majority and a bumper surplus, paired with industrial unrest and rising cost-of living pressure — here are the pearls and pitfalls WA's incoming premier will need to navigate.

title.children: Why Mark McGowan's successor will find the going so much tougher, as challenges mount in the west

image.altText: Mark McGowan in wet weather gear stands hands on hips smiling at volunteers in fire fighting uniforms.

items.synopsis: Mark McGowan took Labor to unprecedented highs in the state's region, but many of the decisions that define his legacy hit residents hard.

title.children: Loved and loathed, McGowan leaves a complex legacy in WA's regions

image.altText: A damaged multi-storey apartment block following a reported drone attack in Moscow.

items.synopsis: Russia fires a barrage of missiles at Kyiv, killing at least one person in an unusual daytime attack on the Ukrainian capital following overnight strikes, while Russian authorities say there has been only minor damage from drone strikes on Moscow.

title.children: Multiple drones hit buildings in Moscow after Russia fires missiles on Kyiv in rare daytime attack

image.altText: Kendall holds his fist to his mouth as he cries watching something out of frame.

items.synopsis: Succession is over and we actually have a successor. So, what did we make of that series finale? Look back on our live discussion where we unpacked that ending and bid farewell to the Roys.

title.children: Let's talk about Succession's triumphant series finale

image.altText: A woman wearing a blue shirt looks down at the camera.

items.synopsis: Eileen Cummings recalls physical abuse from missionaries for speaking in her language and a beating with an electric cord, but final compensation and a chance to share her story has finally brought closure to a dark period in Australian history.

title.children: 'Finally, closure': Stolen Generations survivors reach settlement for historic abuse

image.altText: Engraving on a bracelet owned by Queen Hetepheres in ancient Egypt.

items.synopsis: An analysis of bracelets owned by ancient Egyptian royalty more than 4,500 years ago has found Egypt and Greece were involved in long-distance trade much earlier than realised.

title.children: These bracelets survived tomb robbers and time — now they're helping us understand the 'beginnings of the globalised world'
